p1.name: Game Of Thrones Risk
p1.longDesc: A Risk clone made during a class at my University. I was part of a four person group. I mostly dealt with the AI aspect of the game.

p2.name: MirrorDesktop
p2.desc: A Program that turns your desktop into a mirror!
p2.longDesc: A personal app that I made that uses your webcam to turn your desktop into an updating mirror image. Uses a java library found on github (link to library found in github repository). Created a java UI using java swing.

p3.name: bf1Stats
p3.desc: A small app to track your stats on Battlefield 1 (in progress)
p3.longDesc: I started this app during my internship at American Express. I was working heavily on a web app, and wanted to make a simple one of my own. At the time I was playing Battlefield 1 pretty often with a friend of mine, and wanted to see if I could possible make an app so we could track our stats. Work became a little overwhelming and I didn't have much time to finish the app, so it has been put on the shelf for the time being. I really want to continue working on it, and will do so as soon as possible. Uses AngularJS for the front end, Node.js with Express for the backend. It connects to the battlefield tracker api to get information about a user.

p4.name: Tic Tac Toe
p4.desc: A simple Tic Tac Toe game
p4.longDesc: A simple, console based Tic Tac Toe game coded in C++. I wanted to prepare for my object oriented design class that was fast approaching, as well as be a little more familiar with object oriented programming as a whole. At the time I didn't know much Java, so I put my limited knowledge of C++ to use. The game has 3 levels of AI that each play differently. It was a lot of fun to make.

p5.name: The Oooo App
p5.longDesc: This app is meant to be silly. It has different buttons that play different sound files. I wanted to finish this for my brother as a Christmas present, but finals took too much of my time away to be able to finish it. It is on the back burner right now as I continue my job search.

p6.name: Pixel Sorter
p6.longDesc: A personal app that I made that takes an image file and sorts its pixels. It does two different sorts, one that sorts the image in to a gradient (Full image sort), and one that only sorts by row. Created just to see if it was possible. It was a very fun project that I sometimes go back to. It creates some really cool images! Now available as a service here on my website!
